Sent from my iPad On Oct 12, 2012, at 6:30 PM, "Alan Fairbank" <fairbanka@gmail.com <mailto:fairbanka@gmail.com>> wrote:Dear Rianna:
I believe you must have seen the email to you (of a day or two ago) from Sara Conde of MBO Partners who will be handling my back office, billing, and insurance.
I realize this is a bit late to be raising this question, but is it possible for the Bank to contract with MBO Partners on my behalf? For these 35 days?
Another option is for me to sign the assignment letter as is, and designate MBO Partners as the payee in lieu of myself (when I send any invoices).
I would prefer the first idea, and I would imagine also that there would be some benefits to the Bank in contracting that way, as I would not be designated a WB staff member (subject to all those staff restrictions and requirements) even though I would be a STA.
I know you don't want to be bothered with this kind of matter, but the email from "hrloa" said that, if I had any questions or issues about the proposed contract, that I should contact my "Task Manager", which is you, no?
That doesn't mean you need to deal with this yourself, but please pass my question on to the person (in Human Resources/Contracting) that can answer the question.
Meanwhile, I am continuing full bore on my work.
Best, Alan
